question: Which two countries share the location of the Palatinate Forest-North Vosges Biosphere Reserve?
explanation: The Palatinate Forest-North Vosges Biosphere Reserve was created in 1998 as the first UNESCO trans-boundary biosphere reserve in Europe, located between Germany and France. This biosphere reserve is a fusion of the older Palatinate Forest Nature Park in Germany and Northern Vosges Regional Nature Park in France.
